name: King's Bounty: The Legend
description: King's Bounty: The Legend is an adventure game with tactical turn-based battles and role-playing elements.

reviews.review_text: I never tried a King's Bounty game until a few days ago. I now regret not having discovered this treasure earlier. While only a handful of hours into the game, thus far it has already surpassed all expectations and the regard I had for HOMM 1-6 and Disciples 3. If you liked any of of the HOMM iterations or Disciples, you will appreciate King's Bounty: The Legend. My only regret is in buying the game standalone instead of a bundle which I'll now buy as still a better bargain than grabbing the expansions singularly.   Enjoy Friends :)  EDIT: To give a bit mroe detail the game, I come to King's Bounty with serious HOMM experiece and a bit of Discpiples. IMO, the HOMM and Disciples are grreat series' but they all fall down at the point of eventually aving spent hours upon hours to build huge armies only to find the AI has outdone you. King's Bounty so far has enough in the smaller side quests to be rewarding enough to give the above review while avoiding 'Enemy Heroes' while I build up my Mage in readiness to take over the world ;]  In summary, If you haven't played the series before but enjoy the 'HOMMi=-like' subgenre as I saw it, you will love this game.

10/10 - Little Towns, Big Worlds and an Epic Amount of Content!  I’m way late getting to play this game but it’s still amazing even for today's standards! This game really is really withstanding the test of time. The campaign is pretty epic, and just solely finishing the campaign took me about 33 hours!! If you explore everything and complete all the quests you are looking at about 60-70+ hours of gameplay! Not too bad for just a couple bucks. I’m pleased to announce that there are about 4 more games in this series waiting for me and more to come!  The world exploration, story and turn-based grid combat come together in a brilliant fashion and really keep you captivated longer than you could anticipate! A few points to consider to maximize your enjoyment of the game!   1) The font is super small! There is a mod you can drop in the folder to increase text size; this isn’t available for the other games so take advantage of this since the story is really good. Every character and quest has some serious depth if you care to explore!  2) Until you get the hang of things try to stick to the main storyline indicated with a crown. This will ensure you stick to battles that you can win. You won’t be completing a full island at once since different levels of enemies are all around, it can be easy to mistakenly run into an unbeatable enemy.   3) Prevent frustration and use the right mouse button to click on enemies from afar. This will indicate the power level of the enemy ranging from Very Weak to Invincible! If you are wondering you can defeat enemies up to very strong but proceed at your own risk!   Overall, A MASSIVE value no matter how you look at it. It’s only $7! If you complete the campaign only you are looking at about 21 cents an hour for some fantastic gaming! Feel free to drop me a message if you can’t find the mod. I will complete the other games for sure!     Accidently Reviewed

King's Bounty: The Legend was my first meeting with this kind of turn based RPG and I was left speechless. The game provides so much fun whether you like exploring thoughtfully designed fantasy world in real time or prefer to try out your tactical skills in turn based battles. Units are skillfully balanced and diverse, magic and special skills just add more to the already satisfying diversity of battles. The story may seem to be kind of cliche like, but which 'You are a hero who has to save the world' is not like that, right? For me it provided entertaining background which urged me on. I have also found quite surprising remarks on Prattchetts The Discworld, every fan of this great series has to appreciate those.

The longest game in the world.   Tough and choreful to play as warrior. The mage blows through battles in a timely fashion. If you buy this for $2 you are getting your monies worth. This game doesn't mess around. Your army will get destroyed countlessly just to get a small fraction of power. If you lose a lot of units in a battle you will just continue struggle inching to get through the game. It's a game where you hardly feel like you are making progress until many hours later.   There's a lot of cool ♥♥♥♥ in the game. Marriage/family system, loot, decent written dialogue, and decent music. The only con I can think of is that it will take you a century to finish the game. It's so god damn long. If there was one HOMM game to be all HOMM games. This one is it. I recommened it if you are into HOMM style games, and want something really worth your money.  I highly don't recommened it if you want an rpg/tactics game that you can play through casually. You will never finish it. Don't get me wrong, I really like this series, its just the games in the series are very long. The Legend is long for all the wrong reasons I feel. There's maybe just a bit too much side quests. They hardly feel optional because your progress will get halted very fast. Overall, it's a very well made game. It just feels insanely long.

I really like this game. So much so that I lost my saved game (after 25 hrs of play) and am more than willing to start it over. If you like turn based strategy games ala Heroes of Might and Magic, then you should check this one out.
help me i cant stop playing this game.  annd friendly advice: dont get children after marriage, they take item slot and cant get rid of them o.o
Heroes of Might and Magic with a twist!
Love it, best turn-based strategy i've ever played.

Like HOMM, only not turn-based...it's everything I've ever wanted :D  (the combat is turn-based, moving around the map - isn't.)  Addicting and fun, almost makes me wish I had bought it for the full price instead of waiting for an 80% discount xD   The beginning may seem a bit dull to some people, but it only gets more thrilling as it progresses further.  PS: the protagonist isn't as boring as he looks in the picture.  PPS: Just when I thought things couldn't get any better, my wife gave birth to a magician named 'Gandalf'!  Funny coincidence - that also happened to me in the game.

King's Bounty: The Legend offers very good turn-based fantasy combat. It plays very much like the early Heroes of Might & Magic games which were ironically based on the original King's Bounty game. I do find it superior in many ways primarily due to its integrated story and RPG elements. It's quite an addicting 'play at your own pace' type of game.
Less talk more buy.
Fantastic and a very underrated game. If you like the Heroes of Might and Magic series, get this game! It is single-player only, but well worth the money and the time.
Love this game it hooks you pretty fast and i have a feeling im going to end up buying all of the games in the series.
So much fun! Ok, back to playing!
Great games!

Good upgrade to the oldschool sega game :) Stays true to the original while updating graphics dramatically, making it much more user friendly, improving combat, and adding plenty of little additions that make it that much better, and now has the 'ooh shiny!' distraction problem where you drop 3 hours on a sidequest :)

If you like stories and strategic battles and quests then you'll probably love this combination of RPG and turn-based strategy. It is very similar to Heroes of might and magic 3 (and 5) but instead of campaign and your own castles you have here quests and spirits that help you during battles. And in expansions you have your own magical pet dragon :) This is one of the games that have this 'just one more turn' feeling.
Game isn't masterpiece, but very addictive. I had no clue that I played above 100 hours with one hero. Nice graphic and gameplay!

Developers have a really nice sense of humour :) The game makes you smile quite often. Combat system is amazing, reminds me of good old Heroes of M&M in a good way. The world is interesting to explore. The only flaw is movement. My character gets stuck, trying to run through a wall or barrel sometimes (though it is possible that it's just my 'talent' to control the hero that causes such problems). Overall, the game is worth playing. It is balanced and captivating.
You can marry a frog in this game.

Similar in idea to the Heroes Of Might and Magic series but seeing you control a single hero rather than several. The game is more story and quest driven than the Heroes series making the character development more personal and integral to gameplay. Basic choices in quests result in various rewards with a large number of creatures, spells and lovely colourful graphics. A game you'll keep coming back to.
Game isn't masterpiece, but very addictive. I had no clue that I played above 100 hours with one hero. Nice graphic and gameplay!
Prequel to Crossworld's, always worth a play through

This is great, great game. Especially if you liked HoMM series.  pros: - great tactical combat - units variety - big world to explore with interesting locations - good RPG style character development - RPG style quests  cons: - graphics may be too cartoonish for some tastes (I personally like it/used to it)
The story and quest content is quite wordy and not particularly interesting, but the combat is interesting and tactical. The game offers up a decent amount of playtime.
I originally bought the game because it was cheap and looked interesting. Then I poured 20 hours into it in just a few days. Definitely a game worth getting if you like strategy games.
Must Have Game. Excellent storyline and immersive.
This game is massively addictive and great fun. The plot should not to be taken too seriously though.

Enjoyed the little bit of the game I played. Got burnt out on the battles, they were very similar all the time. Some of the areas didn't seem very balanced but from what I can tell this was the original title and it is a bit dated. Hopefully Armored Princess and Crossworlds played better. Familiar, unique and casual crunched into one. Scoop it on a sale and try it out.  Would probably rate this in the middle everything considered.
If you get a chance to pick this up cheap, I wouldn't pass it over. Fun overhead tactical RPG.
Amazing a very beatufiul Tactical RPG, a must have!
Fun distracting storyish game. Not much more to say.

I had a really good time playing this game and highly recommend it. I've been told that Armored Princess is better, but I think you should play them in order to really enjoy the series.

Hmm, let's see. I bought this game in a fit of nostalgia over the old King's Bounty for Sega Genesis. I became addicted almost immediately. The wealth of quests and characters, the option to take a wife for extra equipment slots, earning the loyalty of and leveling up your chest of rage summons, the many different creatures you can employ (as well as the initial scarcity of these, forcing you to adapt and change up strategies), and the interesting and engaging boss fights and castle seiges are just a few of the things that kept me at the controls for hours at a time. I loved it. I spent an extra twenty hours at end game completing side quests and defeating enemies because I didn't want to complete the game. I would play it all over again. Fortunately there are sequels with equally good reviews, so I won't have to put myself through that.

It's hard to describe this game. It's an oddly addictive turn based, tactical RPG. You move your character in real time, and after you encounter an enemy, it takes you to another screen that has around 20 or so grids that you move your units on. It's very reminiscent of the Might and Magic games. Either way, it's very fun.

The original that started it all! King’s Bounty: The Legend is a terrific, unique, turn-based strategy game with a charming retro feel. The variety of difficulty settings provide a warm welcome to players unfamiliar with the genre and a challenge for veterans. Some people might be turned off by the fact that it’s single-player only, but don’t let that stop you from trying it out. The game provides more than enough content in its campaign to justify its pricetag.   This game deserves so much more praise then it’s gotten.
Funny, simple, engaging think of it as Heroes of might and Masgic but with plot.

I purchased this game on the premise that it was a clone of the Heroes of Might and Magic series. A clone is a bad description. Turn based-yes and battle mechanics-yes. Detailed storyline-No. Leaders directly influencing the battle to the degree they do in HOMM?-No. With that said, King's Bounty: The Legend, gives the player a good gaming experience for the buck. If you are looking to control character creation and upgrades as you do in HOMM, you may want to head in a different direction. Additionally, quirky camera angles and very generic missions make for a game experience that never reaches the feeling of the HOMM series. Simplistic yet rich graphics for a game that came out in 2008. If tactical strategy is your cup of tea then King's Bounty: The Legend is for you.
It was the best game ever. I know, I bought it.

King's Bounty is above all else a strategy game with role playing elements tossed in. However, it gets the mix of the genres right which turns in to long and arduous; but fun, battles and exploration. You explore the world map from close isometric mixed with third person or over head isometric views and engage enemies on the map to get to runes, items and locales. The game runs on Normal skill at roughly 50-60 hours long and much longer on any higher difficulty but I highly recommend Normal for a challenge. The locales are varied, there is almost no VO but the story is intriguing (what little there is). The gameplay is solid and the characters interesting enough. Battles are balanced as are the skill trees of the 3 classes (Warrior, Mage, Paladin) as well as their weaknesses being balanced in combat. I highly recommend this game to anyone who loves Strategy based games with a lot of time on their hands.. and patience.

In my opinion, this is the finest turn-based fantasy strategy game this decade. The Heroes of Might and Magic games are similar, but I just had much more fun playing this one. The artwork is more consistent here, and the monsters and game world feels alive and fun. The hero mechanics are pretty original, too. At a certain point I felt like I hit a brick wall (a few enemies that I just couldn't beat), but maybe I was somewhere I wasn't supposed to be yet. I plan on going back at it with a new character at some point.
A game that takes it's pedigree from the old Heroes of Might and Magic series!
Solid. Plenty of play and options. Gets more difficult as you go.
I love this game. It's simple to learn, challenging to master and very funny. I got my money's worth and then some out of it. It's often on sale nowadays too.

It's very similar to Heroes of Might and Magic except you don't own a castle. Lots of items, units and sidequests to discover. Be careful however since units deplete. The game is a bit dated but graphics still good. Prepare for a long but enjoyable journey because it's not a short run.

There is a difference... Some skills have changed, you have to earn two additional slots for troops, you're a 'male' character, the map is different, and the storyline is as well. Sadly, that is all. The music, controls, graphics, skill outline - it's all the identical twin to the original and the 'expansion.' This would have been fantastic if it were joined with the original game, allowing the different story and male character to be selected at the beginning. OH! There's a vocal intro, but it doesn't put anything to shame. Sadly, I still have to suggest - do not purchase or play unless you're a die-hard fan of the strategy style chess-move games and if you (for some unknown reason) find this series a total knock-out.
A less user friendly, and less goal oriented version of Heroes of Might and Magic 5.
A very weak strategy game using the same formula as HOMM. Poor story, boring world and ridiculous units. One would be better off with any MM game. Avoid unless you are easily amused.
Really weak game. Pretty bad graphics, hilariously bad story/writing, cumbersome game mechanics. An ok timewaster, but I doubt I'll remember the name of the game for more than the next week or so.
